page.title: 09MR.FOTHERGILL'S SEEDS.
page.content: There are 32 people working at Mr.Fothergill's seed packing factory. They have 7 packing machines, 2 are for packing seeds in foil. They have a seed store room,where a dehumidifier keeps the seeds fresh. Some seeds cost 1,000 pounds per small bag. 7,400,000 packets of seeds a year are filled and one person packs 17,000 a day. 500 varieties of seeds are stocked. Their seeds come from Holland, America and Great Britain. As well as the home market, they send them to Malaysia, West Indies, Africa and America, all packed in foil to keep fresh. When the orders come in they try to send them out the same day. They make "starter kits" containing compost, gravel and seeds. By pushing the packs under an electric bar they get rid of static electricity. They send out 15,000 parcels a year by "Roadline".
